source_graph.description: A breakdown of the graph source types in the dataset. Each label indicates whether it applies to the dataset, with supporting evidence from the paper.

Human-Generated.description: The graph is manually created or curated by humans, such as ontologies, citation graphs, or social networks constructed from surveys or human annotations.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this label applies to the dataset. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper where the human-generated nature of the graph is stated or supported (e.g., 'Section 3.2').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the graph is classified as human-generated.

Model-Generated.description: The graph is synthetically produced, either by AI systems or codes.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this label applies to the dataset. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper where the model-generated nature of the graph is stated or supported (e.g., 'Section 3.2').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the graph is classified as model-generated.

Unknown Origin.description: The source of the graph is not specified, not reported, or derived from some data collections with unclear provenance.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if the dataset includes graph with unknown provenance. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper indicating the information of the graph dataset (e.g., 'Appendix A').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the origin is considered unknown.

N/A.description: The dataset does not contain any graph data.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if the dataset contains no graph. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper confirming that the dataset does not include graph (e.g., 'Section 1.1').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the dataset is not applicable for graph-based analysis.
